content:
Diagnosis:		Bilateral breast cancer with lung metastases

Primary Disease:	Left breast - Grade 3 pleomorphic lobular carcinoma diagnosed March 2023
			Right breast - Grade 3 pleomorphic lobular carcinoma diagnosed June 2023
			Both ER positive/PR negative/HER2 negative
			ESR1 mutation detected in ctDNA March 2024

Management:		Left mastectomy April 2023
			Right mastectomy July 2023
			Completed 6 cycles FEC-T chemotherapy December 2023
			Started Fulvestrant/Palbociclib January 2024

Current Status:	Progressive disease with new lung metastases

[redacted name] attended today's breast oncology clinic for urgent review following CT chest showing multiple new bilateral pulmonary nodules, largest measuring 2.1cm in right upper lobe. She reports increasing breathlessness on exertion and persistent dry cough for the past 3 weeks. Her performance status has declined to ECOG 2 from previous ECOG 1. Blood tests show rising CA15-3 at 145 (previously 89). Given detection of ESR1 mutation and disease progression on current endocrine therapy, we will switch treatment to oral Capivasertib with Fulvestrant. I have discussed the side effect profile including potential hyperglycemia and diarrhea. She will start treatment next week following baseline echocardiogram. Review arranged in 2 weeks with blood tests.

primary_cancer.metastases: multiple bilateral pulmonary nodules, largest 2.1cm in right upper lobe
primary_cancer.biomarker_status: ER positive/PR negative/HER2 negative, ESR1 mutation positive

cancer_timeline.value: CT chest showing multiple new bilateral pulmonary nodules, largest 2.1cm in right upper lobe

patient_facts.value: Persistent dry cough for past 3 weeks

status_updates.value: Bilateral breast cancer with new lung metastases and ESR1 mutation. Disease progression on current endocrine therapy with declining performance status
Progressive disease with new pulmonary metastases and rising tumor markers
Switching to oral Capivasertib with Fulvestrant due to ESR1 mutation and disease progression
Performance status declined to ECOG 2 from ECOG 1
Baseline echocardiogram before starting new treatment
Review in 2 weeks with blood tests
